relation: A list of Facets to execute with the given query.
Selector is used to fetch data in the search results, if null only location ids will be fetched.
Enabled by default to use a cached result if the query matches a previous run query with the configured amount of time.
The starting result position, 0 by default.
The number of fetched results, 10 by default.
The minimum number of results to find before returning.
The maximum amount of time the query should execute before timing out.
Sets the uuid of this query, this is normal set by the client so that the status of a running query can be found or the query can be canceled.
Sets a user context, only used for logging at this point.
Enabled by default to cache this result. False would not cache the result.
Sets the start time, if 0 the controller sets the time.

textAfterTable: Enumeration: QueryState The state of a query. RUNNING Query is running. INTERRUPTED Query has been interrupted. COMPLETE Query is complete. RUNNING 0 INTERRUPTED 1 COMPLETE 2 BACK_PRESSURE_INTERRUPTED 3 Enumeration: Status NOT_FOUND Blur status UUID is not found. FOUND Blur status UUID is present. NOT_FOUND 0 FOUND 1 Enumeration: RowMutationType Specifies the type of Row mutation that should occur during a mutation of a given Row. DELETE_ROW Indicates that the entire Row is to be deleted. No changes are made if the specified row does not exist. REPLACE_ROW Indicates that the entire Row is to be deleted, and then a new Row with the same id is to be added. If the specified row does not exist, the new row will still be created. UPDATE_ROW Indicates that mutations of the underlying Records will be processed individually. Mutation will result in a BlurException if the specified row does not exist.
